title: False Prophets and the Righteous Branch
shortSummary: Jeremiah 23 addresses the failure of Israel’s leaders and prophets who have scattered God's people through their unfaithfulness and false teachings. The chapter contrasts these corrupt leaders with the promise of a coming righteous King from David’s line who will bring justice and salvation. It also contains a stern warning against false prophets who deceive the people and misuse God’s name.
timeline: c. 627-586 BC - Late Kingdom of Judah, during Jeremiah's prophetic ministry before the Babylonian exile

keyCharacters.name: Jeremiah
keyCharacters.description: The prophet delivering God's message of judgment against false leaders and hope for a future righteous King.

keyCharacters.name: False Prophets
keyCharacters.description: Prophets who speak lies and deceit, leading Israel astray by claiming peace when judgment is coming.

keyCharacters.name: David (Righteous Branch)
keyCharacters.description: The promised descendant of David who will reign as a just King, bringing salvation and righteousness.

definitions.definition: Shepherds or leaders responsible for guiding and caring for God's people.
A bitter plant used metaphorically to describe suffering and judgment.
A Messianic title referring to the coming King who will embody God's righteousness and salvation.
A prophetic message or oracle from God, often concerning judgment or important revelation.

outline.heading: Condemnation of Unfaithful Shepherds
outline.description: God pronounces woe on the leaders who have scattered His flock, promising to gather the remnant and appoint faithful shepherds who will care for His people.

outline.heading: Promise of the Righteous Branch
outline.description: God foretells the coming of a righteous King from David’s line who will reign with justice and bring safety and salvation to Judah and Israel.

outline.heading: Judgment on False Prophets
outline.description: Jeremiah expresses deep sorrow over the corrupt prophets who lead the people into sin and compares them to the wickedness of Sodom and Gomorrah.

outline.heading: Warning Against Listening to False Prophets
outline.description: God commands the people not to heed the deceptive messages of false prophets who promise peace without God’s counsel and announces coming judgment.

outline.heading: Rebuke of Prophets Prophesying Lies
outline.description: God denounces prophets who claim to speak in His name without His commission, warning of His rejection and punishment for those who pervert His word.

application: Examine the faithfulness of your spiritual leaders and pray for those who shepherd God’s people to lead with integrity and care.
Trust in the promise of Christ, the Righteous Branch, who reigns with justice and brings true peace and salvation.
Discern carefully the messages you receive, testing them against God’s Word to avoid being led astray by false teachings.
Commit to speaking and living the truth of God’s Word faithfully, avoiding the temptation to distort Scripture for personal gain.

keyVerses.text: Behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will raise unto David a righteous Branch, and a King shall reign and prosper, and shall execute judgment and justice in the earth.
keyVerses.significance: This verse prophesies the coming Messiah, Jesus Christ, who will rule with righteousness and justice.

keyVerses.text: Thus saith the LORD of hosts, Hearken not unto the words of the prophets that prophesy unto you: they make you vain: they speak a vision of their own heart, and not out of the mouth of the LORD.
keyVerses.significance: A crucial warning against false prophets who speak from their own imagination rather than God's truth.

keyVerses.text: Is not my word like as a fire? saith the LORD; and like a hammer that breaketh the rock in pieces?
keyVerses.significance: This verse emphasizes the power and authority of God's Word to convict, purify, and break down resistance.

keyVerses.text: And I will bring an everlasting reproach upon you, and a perpetual shame, which shall not be forgotten.
keyVerses.significance: A solemn warning of the enduring consequences for those who reject God's commands and lead His people astray.
